subject: Investing
title: The Efficient Market Hypothesis
description: Learn The Efficient Market Hypothesis in one minute.

hook.text: What if stock prices already reflect all available information? Picking winners would be pointless.

buildup.text: Eugene Fama proposed the Efficient Market Hypothesis in 1970. It shook the investing world.

discovery.text: Three forms: weak, semi-strong, and strong. Each claims prices absorb more types of information.

twist.text: Markets aren't perfectly efficient. Bubbles prove that. But they're efficient enough to be hard to beat.

climax.text: The EMH doesn't say you can't profit. It says you can't profit consistently without extra risk.

punchline.text: Prices aren't perfect, but they're hard to outsmart.

quiz.question: What does the Efficient Market Hypothesis claim?
options: Stock prices reflect all available information
Only insiders can profit from stocks
